subject: Travel
title: The Statue of Zeus at Olympia
description: A fast breakdown of The Statue of Zeus at Olympia for builders.

hook.text: At Olympia, a 40-foot seated Zeus filled an entire temple. Visitors gasped at its size.

buildup.text: Sculptor Phidias built it from ivory plates and gold sheets over a wooden frame around 435 BC.

discovery.text: The statue was so tall that if Zeus stood up, he would have crashed through the roof.

twist.text: It was moved to Constantinople centuries later. Nobody knows exactly when or why.

climax.text: A fire in 475 AD destroyed the statue completely. Only ancient coins show what it looked like.

punchline.text: The king of the gods was lost to a fire.
